title: Marshal's Adventure with Variables
description: Practice question to understand variables, data types, scope, and updating values in JavaScript.
instructions: Marshal is preparing for a journey in CodeLand. He has some magic boxes (variables) to help him. Use the hints below to declare the variables, assign values, and print them in JavaScript.
hints: Marshal’s name should be stored in a variable called heroName.
Marshal starts with 10 coins in heroCoins.
At first, he doesn’t have a sword. Store this in a boolean variable heroHasSword.
After finding a sword, update the variable.
He defeats a monster and earns 50 more coins.
Print all his final stats in the console: name, coins, sword status.
bonusQuestions: What data types did you use for each variable?
What would happen if you tried to print heroHasSword before declaring it?
Make heroCoins a local variable inside a function. Can you print it outside? Why or why not?
